org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.simplerecord
Class SimpleRecordAttributeExistsProcessor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.simplerecord.AbstractSimpleRecordProcessor
          org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.simplerecord.SimpleRecordAttributeExistsProcessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IDataProcessor
public class SimpleRecordAttributeExistsProcessor
extends AbstractSimpleRecordProcessor

Filter an ISimpleRecord based the presence of all of a list of Attributes.

This Processor is a bit of a one off as it can behave as a Filter or as a Processor. It is intended to cover a gap in the expression handling where it is not possible (yet) to refernce attributes that don't exist in a record. This sometimes occurs. This processor is (very) likely to be deprecated once this is no longer an issue. Any function it still serves at that point is likely to be factored into a single function processor or filter.

Default behaviour is to discard any records for which attributes on the mandatoryIncomingRecordAttributes list are missing.

If either of throwExceptionOnMissingAttribute or createOnMissingAttribute are set then the behaviour is different:

throwExceptionOnMissingAttribute set to true:
Throw a RecordFormatException instead of discarding records.

createOnMissingAttribute set to true:
Add the attribute to the reocrd with a null value. NB in this case the Processor acts as a "Processor" rather than a "Filter".

throwExceptionOnMissingAttribute

protected boolean throwExceptionOnMissingAttribute
If true throws RecordFormatException instead of discarding records. Defaults to false.

createOnMissingAttribute

protected boolean createOnMissingAttribute
If true then add the missing attribute with a null value.

discardMatches

protected boolean discardMatches
Flag indicating if matches are passed or blocked.

By default, matches are blocked, and non-matches are passed. In practice this means that by default records with missing attributes are blocked (i.e. discarded).

processSimpleRecord

public java.lang.Object[] processSimpleRecord(ISimpleRecord simpleRecord,
                                              boolean alreadyCloned)
                                       throws RecordException
Process a SimpleRecord noting if it has already been cloned.

If any mandatory records are missing then:

  1. If CreateOnMissingAttribute set then create the missing attributes with null values and return the resulting SimpleRecord.
  2. if ThrowExceptionOnMissingAttribute set then throw a RecordFormatException.
  3. Otherwise based on value of DiscardMatches discard teh record (or don't).

This is all a bit of a bodge. This processor will probably be superceeded by better expression handling and/or dedicated processors in the near future.

Specified by:
processSimpleRecord in class AbstractSimpleRecordProcessor
Parameters:
simpleRecord -
alreadyCloned -
Returns:
Object[] containing the results of processing the record.

RecordException

validate

public void validate(java.util.List exceptions)
Description copied from interface: IDataProcessor
This method checks that the current state of an implementation is "meaningful". Implementations of IDataProcessor are typically beans with zero-arg constructors. Implementations are encouraged to add exception to the list parameter rather than throwing them. This allows the calling code to collate the exceptions. If the implementation is an IComponent then the exceptions should be a ValidationException.

Specified by:
validate in interface IDataProcessor
Overrides:
validate in class AbstractSimpleRecordProcessor
